name: df-2nd
comment: Define a function that extracts the second member, or ordinate, of an ordered pair. Theorem ~ op2nd proves that it does this. For example, ` ( 2nd `` <. 3 , 4 >. ) = 4 ` . Equivalent to Definition 5.13 (ii) of [Monk1] p. 52 (compare ~ op2nda and ~ op2ndb ). The notation is the same as Monk's. (Contributed by NM, 9-Oct-2004.)
